description: I tried several music players looking for one that could access home network music files AND genres sort/play them. Most of the players I tried could genres sort/play of music files in home music folder, or just play files on network but not genres sort/play files on those home network locations. This does both and set up to see album cover as well. Great Job.
summary: Great Music Player App, Definitely Recommend

description:
Having tried loads of Linux music players, it seems it is beyond the capabilities of Linux boffins to create an audio player with a versatile timer/scheduler like the one in Aimp3 (unfortunately only for Windows) which offers a full range of options, not just sleep after x time or no timer at all, as is the case with so many Linux music players!
The Aimp3 scheduler gives the user options to:
- shutdown or hibernate or sleep at chosen or elapsed time or end of file or end of queue or end of playlist 
AND 
- an alarm clock to wake up the computer at chosen or elapsed time, to select to play file or playlist and to set the volume.
Such a feature is vital to me because of my situation, and I feel quite certain it would be welcome by other users! So how about it guys, are you up to the challenge or will I be obliged to continue with Windows on a PC solely used to play music for lack of a Linux music player with such a timer...
